page.title: 13HOLMESCALES FARM
page.content: {Holmescales, Old Hutton,}is a {dairy farm}of{330 acres}with an additional{60 acres}north of{Kendal. About{one third}is{good, flat land, which is cropped for{silage;}another {third}is{steep, mediocre land;}the {final third}provides{rough grazing}for the farm's{205}sheep.{180}friesian cows are{milked}using{micro-chip {technology}- a process which takes {2 hours. 60}bullocks are{fattened}for the{market}using{barley}which has to be{brought in}from{outside.}The area's {growing season}for{cereals}is too {short.}There is only{one bull}as most cows are{artificially {inseminated.}About{10}years ago,{a {riding school}was established here. A weekly{Methodist}Sunday Evening service alternates between{Holmescales and{Strickley Farm (SD 545895).
